content.raw:
You mentioned systems spawning threads on the description, but it seems that all this new interface does is that the `Run` function is called once the moment the simulation runner is constructed. That is, there's nothing exclusive to spinning up threads, right? It would be nice to add some documentation explaining why someone would want to implement the runnable interface. It's not clear to me for example why I'd put something in the `Run` function instead of the constructor.

It would also be good to add a test for a system that implements this interface.
